intro: Epicampes robusta, commonly known as the robust epilith, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its hardy nature, it is often found growing on rocky surfaces in tropical and subtropical regions.
